isis.stitle: 9 SPEED AND 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON 16709 AND 16710 SERIES - REASSEMBLE - SHIFTERHOUSING

step1.para: If previously removed, install the reverse-stop plunger and spring in the 1st-Reverse shift yoke, making sure the plunger is fully seated in the yoke slot bore ( Figure 105). Install the plug and tighten to compress the springs. Back the plug out 1 to 1-1/2 turns after it bottoms.
Complete the yoke assembly process by staking the plug through the small hole in the yoke ( Figure 106).

Install 1st-Reverse shift bar in the lower bore boss. Place the actuating plunger in its bore and place one 3/4 inch interlock ball in the interlock bore down against the 1st-Reverse rail ( Figure 107).

note.para: Start with the lower shift bore of the rear boss and move to the left (front of housing). Keep bars in the neutral position during installation.

caution.para: DO NOT EXCEED the recommended torque ratings for yoke lockscrews as over-tightening may distort the shift bars.

step1.para: While holding the notched end of the bar, install the 2nd-3rd speed shift bar in the housing boss middle bore ( Figure 108). Position the shift block on the bar between the center and rear bosses, and the yoke on the bar between the front and center bosses, long hub to the housing front. Just before inserting the notched end of the rear boss bar, install the small interlock pin VERTICALLY in the neutral notch bore. Install the block and yoke lockscrews, tighten to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N• m), and lockwire securely.

note.para: It is necessary that the interlock pin remain in a vertical position during reassembly as rotation of the bar causes the pin to jam in the tension spring bores.

step1.para: Install the other 3/4 inch interlock ball in the rear boss top bore ( Figure 109). This ball rides between the 2nd-3rd and the 4th-5th speed shift bars.

While holding the notched end of the bar, install the 4th-5th speed shift bar in the housing boss upper bore and position the shift block on the bar between the center and rear bosses. Position the yoke on the bar between the front and center bosses, long hub to the housing rear ( Figure 110). Install the block and yoke lockscrews, tighten to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N• m), and lockwire securely.
Install the oil trough on the housing ( Figure 111). Tighten the bolts to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N• m).
Remove the assembly from the vise. Install the three tension balls, one in each bore on the housing top ( Figure 112). Place a detent spring over each ball to complete the assembly.
